acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court papers from Charlotte County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The business records of Cronin, Hannah, and Company were used as evidence in the chancery case, Administrator of James Maloney versus Cronin, Hannah, and Company, heard in the Circuit Court of Charlotte County.

Cronin, Hannah, and Company was a general store that conducted business in the town of Coles Finz during the mid-nineteenth century. The partnership was comprised of Robert W. Cronin, George C. Hannah, and Benjamin W. Marshall. The partnership was formerly known as Cronin and Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Cronin, Hannah, and Company Cashbook, 1861-1870, records on an almost daily basis cash received and cash paid out. It includes the names of individuals the business received cash from and paid cash to.

Cronin, Hannah and Company Journal, 1861-1874, records on a monthly basis, mainly in 1861, the individual accounts of customers. Each account lists transactions in chronological order, items purchased, and amount owed or paid. Merchandise sold include dry-goods (thread, calico, needles, buttons), molasses, pants, castor oil, and whiskey. Volume is in fragile condition due to water and mold damage. Ink is very faint.

Cronin and Company Ledgers A-1 and B, 1865-1868, records the accounts of individual customers. Each account lists transactions in chronological order, items purchased, and the amount owed and paid. Merchandise sold include whiskey, dry-goods, eggs, nails, fish hooks, and farm tools.

Cronin and Company Index book to a missing ledger that records in alphabetical order the names of the company's customers. Beside each name is the page number of the customer's account found in the ledger. Volume is in fragile condition due to mold damage.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: For additional information see the Charlotte County Chancery Cause, Administrator of James Maloney versus Cronin, Hannah, and Company. It can be found in the Chancery Records Index at the Library of Virginia web site. The index number is 1871-001.
